{"blocks":[{"key":"fbrtf","text":"Transfer 1 mL of the supernatant to a clean 2.2 mL deep-well 96-well plate for archiving/backup and retain the rest in the original plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

For medium-sized caterpillars (e.g. Noctua pronuba or Pieris brassicae) we use 5 ml screwcap eppendorf tubes (# 0030122313) with one 4 or 4.5 mm steel bead and 2 ml of Lysis Buffer 1. For smaller caterpillars (e.g. leaf miners) use 2 ml screwcap tubes and two 3 mm beads and for larger caterpillars (e.g. hawkmoth caterpillars) you may need to use 15 ml or even 50 ml tubes with larger or multiple steel beads*.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4du4m","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":143,"offset":0,"style":"italic"},{"length":14,"offset":63,"style":"bold"},{"length":14,"offset":79,"style":"bold"},{"length":12,"offset":98,"style":"bold"}],"key":"2c7l","text":"*When using tubes smaller or larger than 5 ml scale volumes of Lysis Buffer 1, Lysis Buffer 2 and Proteinase K throughout to match tube volume.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"3602CFD04DEB11EC8FD269801B386E57","url":"https://online-shop.eppendorf.co.uk/UK-en/Laboratory-Consumables-44512/Tubes-44515/EppendorfTubes-5.0mL-PF-156668.html#Accessory"},"mutability":"","type":"link"}}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":35,"offset":0,"style":"italic"},{"length":35,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"dhbe7","text":"Note on steel bead material choice:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dn085","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":313,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"7mv23","text":"If you are extracting already collected caterpillars in the lab for immediate DNA extraction, you can use the cheaper carbon steel ball bearings. If you plan to use pre-prepared tubes for direct collection of caterpillars into lysis buffer in the field*, use stainless steel bearings to prevent them from rusting.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"17gbg","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":101,"offset":0,"style":"italic"},{"length":14,"offset":25,"style":"bold"},{"length":1,"offset":47,"style":"sup"}],"key":"dov79","text":" *Caterpillars stored in Lysis Buffer 1 at -20 oC are extractable at least 6 months after collection.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
